intro: Hyssopus ocymifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hyssop, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces spikes of blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its aromatic foliage and historical use in herbal medicine, it is valued both ornationally and for its medicinal properties.
